intro: Phacelia egena, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phacelia egena is known for its short growing season and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
